title: Express Talk: Hokusai’s Great Wave
hero_caption: Katsushika Hokusai. Under the Wave off Kanagawa (Kanagawa oki nami ura), also known as the Great Wave, from the series Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji (Fugaku sanjurokkei), 1825–1838. Clarence Buckingham Collection.
description:
Enjoy one of the most iconic images in the history art. Commonly called The Great Wave, Katsushika Hokusai’s masterpiece is rarely exhibited due to it's delicate nature. Lucas Livingston leads a lively conversation on the artistry, history, and connoisseurship surrounding not one, not two, but three versions of The Great Wave exhibited side-by-side. 

Join us again for this talk on June 19. See also Gallery Talk: Connoisseurship of Japanese Prints on May 2 and May 21.
